name: NSTextRange
desc: A class that represents a contiguous range between two locations inside document contents.

items.name: init(location: NSTextLocation)
items.desc: Creates a new text range at the location you specify.

items.name: init?(location: NSTextLocation, end: NSTextLocation?)
items.desc: Creates a new text range with the starting and ending locations you specify.

items.name: var endLocation: NSTextLocation
items.desc: Returns the ending location of the text range.

items.name: var isEmpty: Bool
items.desc: Returns whether the text range is empty.

items.name: var location: NSTextLocation
items.desc: Returns the starting location of the text range.

items.name: func intersection(NSTextRange) -> Self?
items.desc: Returns the range, if any, where two text ranges intersect.

items.name: func union(NSTextRange) -> Self
items.desc: Returns a new text range by forming the union with the text range you provide.

items.name: func contains(NSTextLocation) -> Bool
items.desc: Determines if the text location you specify is in the current text range.

items.name: func contains(NSTextRange) -> Bool
items.desc: Determines if the text range you specify is in the current text range.
